words.definition: A block is a solid piece of wood, stone or ice.
words.example: I saw a block of ice on the street.

words.definition: To cheer is to give a loud shout of approval or encouragement.
words.example: The crowd all cheered when the home team won.

words.definition: If something is complex, it has many small parts. It is hard to understand.
words.example: A car engine is complex because it has many parts.

words.definition: A critic is someone who gives their opinions about movies, books, etc.
words.example: The wine critic tasted the wine so he could give his opinion.

words.definition: An event is something that happens, especially something important.
words.example: Finishing high school was a major event in his life.

words.definition: To exercise is to run or play sports so that you can be healthy.
words.example: You should exercise every day.

words.definition: If something fits, it is the small size or the right shape to go in a particular place.
words.example: The key fits the lock.

words.definition: Friendship is the relationship between people who are friends.
words.example: Michael and Peter have a very strong friendship.

words.definition: A guide is someone who shows you where to go.
words.example: We hired a guide to help us explore the city.

words.definition: If there is a lack of something, there is not enough of it.
words.example: His only problem is a lack of money.

words.definition: To perform is to do something in front of people who watch.
words.example: He will perform a song tonight.

words.definition: Pressure is what you feel when you are worried about something.
words.example: They are under a lot of pressure to finish the work.

words.definition: If something is probable, it is likely to happen.
words.example: It is probable that it will rain today.

words.definition: If something is public, it is meant for everyone to use.
words.example: I go to the public park to play with my friends.

words.definition: Smart means intelligent.
words.example: Mary is a smart girl.

words.definition: To strike someone or something is to hit them.
words.example: She struck the ball with her bat.

words.definition: To support something is to help it be successful.
words.example: Everyone at work supports the new plan.

words.definition: A task is a piece of work to be done.
words.example: Who had the task of cleaning the room?

words.definition: A term is a word or expression used in a particular language or subject.
words.example: I often hear the term “global warming.”

words.definition: To unite is to get together to do something.
words.example: If we unite, we can finish our project faster.
